Post_Title: Japan manager Hajime Moriyasu bows to the fans to thank them for their support!

Threads.Reply_Text:
That moment when you realize that TWO East-Asian teams scored more goals combined than all FOUR Concacaf teams combined. Five goals each to Japan and Korea in four matches each.

The US scored three, Mexico scored two, Costa Rica scored three, and Canada 1. That's nine goals between all CONCACAF teams that have gone home already, and only a mere TWO East-Asian teams outscored them all.

Football? SK/Japan > North America

Cinema & TV? SK/Japan > North America

Cars? SK/Japan > North America

You can take one random east Asian country alone and it would be the same.
but do they have FREEDUM?

Eh cinema and TV I don't think so.

The Vengeance Trilogy, I saw the Devil, The Handmaiden, Memories of Murder, A Bittersweet Life, The Host and The Man From Nowhere were awesome, but Kdramas suck.

For Japan there is Anime but no great modern movies besides Your Name and Ghibli movies. And I guess 13 assassin's. Outrage is ok. Sonatine is great but you're getting into classics. And the Kurosawa films are great if you are counting a bygone era.
A silent voice

Bro Drive My Car released last year. That movie was insanely good.

Japanese movie scene is niche compared to Anime and Anime films, but still very much active.

Also Your Name and Ghibli Movies are not even half of the good shit from animated side as well. Trigger with Promare, Madhouse with Redline, an entire bag of Satoshi Kon films, another bag of Makoto Shinkai films, Ufotable just making great animated pieces one after the other with Fate and Demon Slayer, and the list goes on.

There are good kdramas but they are usually not the ones that become popular, especially since they try to cater to the netflix crowd these days. I got into game of thrones because it reminded me of all the politicking from the historical kdramas way before the hallyu wave. The late kim ki duk's movies were also good. Squid game sucks and hollywood has ripped off some stuff from japanese film

Hey, I was just doing the numbers, and that's the conclusion I came out with. Any way you look at it, it's gotta be one of the biggest embarrassments in the 2022 World Cup thus far, when two teams far outstrip the scoring capablilites of a combined four. This sport is about making the ball go into the net after all, everything else is just technical jargon.
A bunch of goals in one game does not a consistently good team make. Spain got 7 in one game but lost to Japan.
